item.title: Emerging Non-Hermitian Topology in a Chiral-Driven-Dissipative Bose-Hubbard Model
item.description:
Author(s): Laszlo Rassaert, Tomás Ramos, Tommaso Roscilde, and Diego Porras

We introduce a driven-dissipative Bose-Hubbard chain describing coupled lossy photonic modes, in which time-reversal symmetry is broken by a coherent drive with a uniform phase gradient. We investigate this model by means of a Gaussian variational ansatz and numerically prove that the steady-state s…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 203603] Published Thu Nov 13, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Laszlo Rassaert, Tomás Ramos, Tommaso Roscilde, and Diego Porras

We introduce a driven-dissipative Bose-Hubbard chain describing coupled lossy photonic modes, in which time-reversal symmetry is broken by a coherent drive with a uniform phase gradient. We investigate this model by means of a Gaussian variational ansatz and numerically prove that the steady-state s…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 203603] Published Thu Nov 13, 2025
item.dc:title: Emerging Non-Hermitian Topology in a Chiral-Driven-Dissipative Bose-Hubbard Model

item.title: Polarization-Driven Charge Frustration and Emergent Phases in the One-Dimensional Extended Hubbard Model
item.description:
Author(s): Sourabh Saha, Jeroen van den Brink, Manoranjan Kumar, and Satoshi Nishimoto

Charge frustration stemming from polarization-induced competing interactions drives unconventional insulating behavior in a one-dimensional extended Hubbard model.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206504] Published Thu Nov 13, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Sourabh Saha, Jeroen van den Brink, Manoranjan Kumar, and Satoshi Nishimoto

Charge frustration stemming from polarization-induced competing interactions drives unconventional insulating behavior in a one-dimensional extended Hubbard model.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206504] Published Thu Nov 13, 2025

item.title: Superballistic Paradox in Electron Fluids: Relevance of Tomographic Transport
item.description:
Author(s): Jorge Estrada-Álvarez, Elena Díaz, and Francisco Domínguez-Adame

Electron hydrodynamics encompasses the exotic fluidlike behavior of electrons in two-dimensional materials such as graphene. It accounts for superballistic conduction, also known as the Gurzhi effect, where increasing temperature reduces the electrical resistance. In analogy with conventional fluids…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206301] Published Wed Nov 12, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Jorge Estrada-Álvarez, Elena Díaz, and Francisco Domínguez-Adame

Electron hydrodynamics encompasses the exotic fluidlike behavior of electrons in two-dimensional materials such as graphene. It accounts for superballistic conduction, also known as the Gurzhi effect, where increasing temperature reduces the electrical resistance. In analogy with conventional fluids…

item.title: Effects of Landau Level Mixing on Various Fractional Quantum Hall States in Trilayer Graphene
item.description:
Author(s): Simrandeep Kaur, Harsimran Singh, Kenji Watanabe, Takashi Taniguchi, Unmesh Ghorai, Manish Jain, Rajdeep Sensarma, and Aveek Bid

We present a detailed experimental study of the effect of Landau level mixing on various fractional quantum Hall states (FQHs) about half filling in a multiband system, namely, Bernal stacked trilayer graphene (TLG). In pristine TLG, the excitation energy gaps, Landé $g$ factor, effective mass, and …


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206501] Published Wed Nov 12, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Simrandeep Kaur, Harsimran Singh, Kenji Watanabe, Takashi Taniguchi, Unmesh Ghorai, Manish Jain, Rajdeep Sensarma, and Aveek Bid

We present a detailed experimental study of the effect of Landau level mixing on various fractional quantum Hall states (FQHs) about half filling in a multiband system, namely, Bernal stacked trilayer graphene (TLG). In pristine TLG, the excitation energy gaps, Landé g factor, effective mass, and di…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206501] Published Wed Nov 12, 2025

item.title: Non-Hermitian Numerical Renormalization Group: Solution of the Non-Hermitian Kondo Model
item.description:
Author(s): Phillip C. Burke and Andrew K. Mitchell

Non-Hermitian (NH) Hamiltonians describe open quantum systems, nonequilibrium dynamics, and dissipative processes. Although a rich range of single-particle NH physics has been uncovered, many-body phenomena in strongly correlated NH systems have been far less well studied. The Kondo effect, an impor…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206502] Published Wed Nov 12, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Phillip C. Burke and Andrew K. Mitchell

Non-Hermitian (NH) Hamiltonians describe open quantum systems, nonequilibrium dynamics, and dissipative processes. Although a rich range of single-particle NH physics has been uncovered, many-body phenomena in strongly correlated NH systems have been far less well studied. The Kondo effect, an impor…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206502] Published Wed Nov 12, 2025

item.title: All-Electrical Self-Switching of van der Waals Chiral Antiferromagnet
item.description:

Antiferromagnets have garnered significant attention due to their negligible stray field and ultrafast magnetic dynamics, which are promising for high-density and ultrafast spintronic applications. Their dual functionality as both spin sources and information carriers could enable all-electrical sel…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 206701] Published Wed Nov 12, 2025

item.title: Anomalous Nodal Gap in a Doped Spin-$1/2$ Antiferromagnetic Mott Insulator
item.description:

Many emergent phenomena appear in doped Mott insulators near the insulator-to-metal transition. In high-temperature cuprate superconductors, superconductivity arises when antiferromagnetic (AFM) order is gradually suppressed by carrier doping, and a $d$-wave superconducting gap forms when an enigmat…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 196403] Published Fri Nov 07, 2025

item.title: Circular Dichroism in Resonant Inelastic X-Ray Scattering: Probing Altermagnetic Domains in MnTe
item.description:
Author(s): D. Takegami, T. Aoyama, T. Okauchi, T. Yamaguchi, S. Tippireddy, S. Agrestini, M. García-Fernández, T. Mizokawa, K. Ohgushi, Ke-Jin Zhou, J. Chaloupka, J. Kuneš, A. Hariki, and H. Suzuki

Two new techniques use circularly polarized x rays to characterize a new and potentially useful form of magnetism.

item.title: Spin-Disorder-Induced Angular Anisotropy in Polarized Magnetic Neutron Scattering
item.description:
Author(s): Ivan Titov, Mathias Bersweiler, Michael P. Adams, Evelyn Pratami Sinaga, Venus Rai, Štefan Liščák, Max Lahr, Thomas L. Schmidt, Vladyslav M. Kuchkin, Andreas Haller, Kiyonori Suzuki, Nina-Juliane Steinke, Diego Alba Venero, Dirk Honecker, Joachim Kohlbrecher, Luis Fernández Barquín, and Andreas Michels

We experimentally report a hitherto unseen angular anisotropy in the polarized small-angle neutron scattering (SANS) cross section of a magnetically strongly inhomogeneous material. Based on an analytical prediction using micromagnetic theory, the difference between the spin-up and spin-down SANS cr…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 196706] Published Thu Nov 06, 2025

Based on an analytical prediction using micromagnetic theory, the difference between the spin-up and spin-down SANS cr…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 196706] Published Thu Nov 06, 2025

item.title: Moiré Band Theory for M-Valley Twisted Transition Metal Dichalcogenides
item.description:
Author(s): Chao Lei, Perry T. Mahon, and A. H. MacDonald

We propose twisted bilayers of certain group IV and IVB trigonal transition metal dichalcogenides (TMDs) ${\mathrm{MX}}_{2}$ ($\mathrm{M}=\mathrm{Zr}$, Hf, Sn and $\mathrm{X}=\mathrm{S}$, Se) as moiré materials. In monolayer form, these TMDs have conduction band minima near the three inequivalent Br…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 196402] Published Wed Nov 05, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Chao Lei, Perry T. Mahon, and A. H. MacDonald

We propose twisted bilayers of certain group IV and IVB trigonal transition metal dichalcogenides (TMDs) MX2 (M=Zr, Hf, Sn and X=S, Se) as moiré materials. In monolayer form, these TMDs have conduction band minima near the three inequivalent Brillouin zone M points and negligible spin-orbit coupling…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 196402] Published Wed Nov 05, 2025
item.dc:title: Moiré Band Theory for M-Valley Twisted Transition Metal Dichalcogenides
item.dc:creator: Chao Lei, Perry T. Mahon, and A. H. MacDonald

item.title: Chiral Graviton Modes on the Lattice
item.description:
Author(s): Hernan B. Xavier, Zeno Bacciconi, Titas Chanda, Dam Thanh Son, and Marcello Dalmonte

Chiral graviton modes are elusive excitations arising from the hidden quantum geometry of fractional quantum Hall states. It remains unclear, however, whether this picture extends to lattice models, where continuum translations are broken and additional quasiparticle decay channels arise. We present…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 196501] Published Tue Nov 04, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Hernan B. Xavier, Zeno Bacciconi, Titas Chanda, Dam Thanh Son, and Marcello Dalmonte

Chiral graviton modes are elusive excitations arising from the hidden quantum geometry of fractional quantum Hall states. It remains unclear, however, whether this picture extends to lattice models, where continuum translations are broken and additional quasiparticle decay channels arise. We present…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 196501] Published Tue Nov 04, 2025

item.title: Topological Magneto-optics in the Noncoplanar Antiferromagnet ${\mathrm{Co}}_{1/3}{\mathrm{NbS}}_{2}$: Imaging and Writing Chiral Magnetic Domains
item.description:
Author(s): E. Kirstein, H. Park, I. Martin, J. F. Mitchell, N. J. Ghimire, and S. A. Crooker

Researchers use a magneto-optical technique to image and manipulate magnetic domains in a chiral antiferromagnet, opening new routes for spin-based electronics.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 196702] Published Tue Nov 04, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): E. Kirstein, H. Park, I. Martin, J. F. Mitchell, N. J. Ghimire, and S. A. Crooker

Researchers use a magneto-optical technique to image and manipulate magnetic domains in a chiral antiferromagnet, opening new routes for spin-based electronics.


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 196702] Published Tue Nov 04, 2025
